DOC.brief_summary: Measuring hemodynamic parameters in ventilated patients is important yet still complicated to perform. Inert gas rebreathing (IGR) showed promising results when being compared to other invasive as well as non-invasive techniques for the measurement of cardiac output. The aim of our study is to evaluate the feasibility of IGR in ventilated patients.
DOC.brief_title: Inert Gas Rebreathing in Ventilated Patients
DOC.criteria: age 18 80 years mechanically ventilated patient existing PiCCO arterial line FiO2 > 60% (fraction of inspired oxygen) PEEP > 10 mmHg (positive endexpiratory pressure) SO2 < 90% (oxygen saturation ) Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg Heart rate > 150 bpm APRV (airway pressure release ventilation) ICD (implantable cardioverter defibrillator) / pace maker [ Anaesthetic Conserving Device (Anaconda) ]
